notesStmt.note: Other editions: The addendum went through several reprints.
Connected editions: The Everyday Cyclopedia日用百科全書 (1919), The Newly Compiled Everyday Cyclopedia 重編日用百科全書 (1934).

msIdentifier.repository: Library of the Institute of Chinese Studies

msContents.p: Table of contents: a division of the 43 topics, which are further subdivided, listed in the beginning of the book. The old category “Magical calculation”術數 was completely left out.

Contents: The addendum adds new facts and materials to the original version. It also views topics from another perspective, f.e. for history in a more international way. Although most of the categories are the same, the content in general is, as the name says, an addendum.

history.p: A scan of the work is available at the library of the Institute of Chinese Studies, Heidelberg University.

settingDesc.p: There were many editors, whereby He Songling functioned as the chief editor.
The Shanghai yinshuguan (Commercial Press) hired many translators, who were often studying in Europe or the USA. Some of the editors of this cyclopedia possibly did have such a background.
Compared to the original edition the editors changed in total.

The publisher Shanghai yinshuguan was founded in 1897. Shanghai yinshuguan later became a very influential press, publishing primary and secondary education textbooks, dictionaries, as well as important magazines: "Eastern Miscellany" (東方雜誌), "Education Magazine" (教育雜誌), "The Short Story Magazine" (小說月報), "Youth Magazine" (少年雜誌), "Students' Magazine" (學生雜誌). The publishing house acted without government support, its publishing strategy was market-oriented.

textDesc.constitution: A complete text, ordered into 43 categories, which are written in an essayist form. The entries are smaller than the original, as it only adds facts the cyclopedia published six years before. Every entry is separately paginated.
textDesc.derivation: It might draw on different kinds of sources from Western and Chinese origin as did the original.
textDesc.purpose: The book was intended to inform and educate the common citizen of the new Chinese nation and creates an indispensable general knowledge. Includes many practical devices and often reads more like a user manual.
